text: there are over a hundred different bands
for the Apple watch while they are
looking to match your outfit or to spice
things up for a new season here's how to
change your Apple watch band start by
placing your Apple watch face down on a
soft lint-free surface this will prevent
it from getting any scratches when
changing your watch band air at the top
and bottom of the watch you'll find the
band release buttons if you're just
looking to change the size of the watch
band remove the longer half of the band
by holding down the release button as
you're pressing slide the watch band to
either side in the case that your watch
band is stuck or jammed into connector
let go of the release button press on it
again and continue sliding it out to add
your new band aligning with the band
connector of the watch so that the text
is facing you and slide it back in you
should feel a click when the band is
properly attached gently tug the watch
band to make sure it's in place to
change the watch band entirely repeat
the steps with the other half tube and
[Music]
lastly if your watch band still feels
out of place you may be using one that
wasn't intended for your watch size as
of today there are four different sizes
for the Apple watch while they all use
the same band connector you won't
necessarily get the best fit if the
watch band size doesn't match the watch
case according to Apple the thirty eight
and forty millimeter watch bands are
interchangeable as out of 42 and 44
millimeter watch bands that's it you've
successfully changed your Apple watch
band did you find this video helpful
comment below and let us know or if you
know of any alternative methods share in
the comments
